Hey fam!

Needing help figuring something out: how to NOT render some notes into individual pages (in pagination), but still add all items to a collection or have then in 'getFilteredByTag' on .eleventy.config

---
EDIT: I think I found a solution. Is it too bad to use collection.getAll()[0].data.mytoots on eleventyConfig? Or something expected to be done, but just that I didn't see in the docs?

original question below
---

longer explanation - branch link at the end:

I have markdown notes in a notes folder + toots stored locally, loaded in a global data file on /_data.

Currently, I also have a /toots folder that has the toot.md template + javascript data file for some eleventyComputed things, which include adding the 'note' tag.

Then, on my config file, I have a addCollection(notes, ...), that loads everything tagged as 'note' and creates a 'notes' collection, which is a merge of the markdown notes + toots.

Then, a 'notes.md' will generate the notes tab, with X notes per page.

This works fine now, BUT, I wanted to skip rendering individual pages for some of the toots (/toots/toot.md). Since the current flow is globalData -> toot.md -> toots.11tydata.js -> eleventy.js (addCollection) -> notes.md, I was not able to do that.

I guess I'm too used to this flow, so I can't think of anything else other than maybe accessing global data directly on eleventy.config, keep adding all toots to the notes collection, and add some (the ones I want to have its own page) to another new collection, and then use a .md template for that.

Any suggestions?

Branch: https://github.com/thiagomgd/geekosaurblog/tree/toots

posts.title: Making blog updates, again
posts.content:
One of the things about using Obsidian to write my blog notes instead of Notion, is that it gets harder to do that on mobile - I use Obsidian-sync, not git.

So now I basically wanted something to simplify posting a journal/note to my blog, so I decided to go with Mastodon. Just finished doing a basic implementation to load toots and build the notes, as I already do with the md files. Let's see how it goes

Started watching From yesterday - it's on Paramount+ and also their channel on Prime Video.

Two episodes in and I'm very interested already. Love this kind of "we can't get out of here and monsters come at night" type of story, and the setting and characters seem interesting.

Also nice that it's already been renewed for S2, which is starting late April - that's actually the reason I decided to start it
